title: Exception page (with APP_DEBUG=true) cannot be rendered when DateTimeImmutable is used as binding in SQL query
body:
### Laravel Version

11.44.7

### PHP Version

8.3.21

### Database Driver & Version

MySQL 8.0.41

### Description

Code that is used to resolve bindings is able to handle objects implementing `DateTimeInterface` as bindings:
https://github.com/laravel/framework/blob/11.x/src/Illuminate/Database/Connection.php#L745

On the other hand, Exception renderer, that was introduced in Laravel 11 is not able to handle rendering such bindings and it throws exception: 
```
Object of class DateTimeImmutable could not be converted to string (View: ....../vendor/laravel/framework/src/Illuminate/Foundation/resources/exceptions/renderer/components/context.blade.php)
```

Exception occurs, because this code: https://github.com/laravel/framework/blob/11.x/src/Illuminate/Foundation/Exceptions/Renderer/Exception.php#L212 doesn't handle `DateTimeInterface` (which misses `__toString` method).


### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create table `users` with column `created_at`  if not present
2. set `APP_DEBUG=true` in `.env`
3. create endpoint with code
```
$router->get('binding_problems', function () {
DB::table('users')
        ->select('*')
        ->where('created_at',  '>', new \DateTimeImmutable())
        ->get()
        ->all();
    throw new \Exception('We should see Laravel 11 error page, but we see Symfony Exception page');
});
```
4. query that endpoint (e.g. `localhost/binding_problems`)

Expected: "new" Laravel page should be rendered  (with list of Database queries containing one query)
Actual: "old" Symfony error page is rendered
